item.title: Divinity: Original Sin II – Definitive Edition now available for PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

A free upgrade from the previous generation versions.

Larian Studios has released PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2 versions versions of strategy RPG Divinity: Original Sin II – Definitive Edition, the developer announced. It is available as a free upgrade from the existing PlayStation 4, Xbox One, or Switch versions.

For new buyers, Divinity: Original Sin II – Definitive Edition is currently on sale at a a 75 percent-off discount price of $14.99 for PlayStation, 35 percent-off discount price of $17.49 for Xbox, and a 50 percent-off discount price of $24.99 for Switch.

Divinity: Original Sin II – Definitive Edition first launched for PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam and GOG on August 31, 2018, followed by Switch on September 4, 2019, and iPadOS on May 18, 2021.

Here is an overview of the game, via Larian Studios:

From the creators of Baldur’s Gate III, experience the world of Divinity in this epic adventure where your choices shape fate itself.

The Divine is dead. The Void approaches. And the powers lying dormant within you are soon to awaken. Choose your role in a BAFTA-winning story, and explore a world that reacts to who you are, and the choices you make. With five races to choose from, and an adventure playable solo or as a party of up to four, lay waste to an oppressive order in a world afraid of magic. Become the God the world so desperately needs.

Divinity: Original Sin II – Definitive Edition is the most complete version of the best-selling, Metacritic Must-Play RPG.

Watch the launch trailer below.

item.title: Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart for Switch launches in spring 2026 in Asia with English language support
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Physical edition pre-orders open on December 18.

eastasiasoft will release the Switch version of Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart in Asia in spring 2026, the publisher announced. It will include English text support, as well as voice-overs in both English and Japanese.

The Switch version of Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart first launched on Due out on February 13, 2025 in Japan.

Physical editions will be available for pre-order via Play-Asia starting December 18 at 7:00 a.m. PT / 10:00 a.m. ET. The standard edition will cost $39.99, while a 2,000-print Limited Edition will also be available for $59.99. The latter includes the game, manual, a soundtrack CD, art book, Joy-Con stickers, a mini case, acrylic standees, and a numbered certificate in a collector’s box.

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via eastasiasoft:

About

The CPUs of each of the four nations are locked in heated battle against one another for dominion over this world. Just as Noire is one step away from complete domination, the CPUs are suddenly robbed of their powers by an unknown force. Now in order to save the world from destruction, the four CPUs must unite Gamarket and defeat the onslaught!

Unlike previous Hyperdimension Neptunia games, Hyperdevotion Noire is not set within the world of Gamindustri, but instead within a similar, but separate, world known as Gamarket! This time Noire takes the lead in grid-based tactical combat with familiar friends at her side. Customize units, activate special abilities by linking characters through the Lily System and outmaneuver enemies on the battlefield, all the while earning points to personalize your home base in Sim Noire mode!

Key Features

  • Engage in tactical combat on grid-based battlefields!
  • Link up with the Lily System to enhance ultra-special moves and reduce goddess transformation costs.
  • Enter Sim Noire mode and use in-game points to furnish your home base and trigger special scenes!
  • Get zombie-fied, pixelated and more with wild status ailments that are both boon and burden.
  • Experiment and customize your battle gear with items earned from defeating enemies!

item.title: Parking Garage Rally Circuit DX announced for consoles, PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Browser version available today.

Walaber Entertainment has announced Parking Garage Rally Circuit DX, an enhanced version of its 2024-released Parking Garage Rally Circuit with twice the amount of content. It is available today for $14.99 via the launched marketplace Wavedash, which allows you to play games in your browser with no client download or special hardware required. A release will follow for unspecified consoles and PC via Steam in 2026.

“What started as the idea of delivering a little more content for Parking Garage Rally Circuit has expanded into what is effectively a whole new game that doubles the size of the original,” said Walaber Entertainment founder Tim Fitzrandolph in a press release. “I’m really excited that Parking Garage Rally Circuit DX is part of the launch of a new platform in Wavedash that reduces friction and complexity for players to discover and play games like mine. I look forward to coming back next year with more news on bringing DX and the European Tour to Steam and console players.”

  • ❮
  • ❯

Here is an overview of the game, via Walaber Entertainment:

Parking Garage Rally Circuit DX doubles the content of the original release with the addition of the new European Tour, adding eight multistorey car parks to drift through on top of the original eight American parking garages to make a total of 16 tracks.

Visit multistory car parks in Paris (Art Car Park), York (York Castle Car Park), Turin (Car Factory), Montpellier (Double Loop), Hamburg (Concert Hall), Copenhagen (Power Plant), Geneva (Parking Tour), and Naples (Cave Park) as you drift and boost your way to victory in the single-player mode, or against other players online. These locations are all inspired by real multistorey carparks, though the odd underwater tunnel or falling stalactites may suggest a touch of artistic liberty. Do it all to a full new soundtrack from The Holophonics, the band behind the catchy tunes that graced the original game.

Designed to look, feel and sound like a lost SEGA Saturn game that could have been released in 1998, Parking Garage Rally Circuit DX delivers delightfully fun racing that’s easy to pick up and play with its chainable Mario Kart-style boosts, but requires skill to master as you unlock new car classes and compete to top the leaderboards. Head online to create and join lobbies of up to eight players and race on any track, with any car class, gaining points after each race. The game also features an arcade-style “Endurance” mode where you keep doing laps until you run out of time and cheat codes to discover that unlock fun modifiers, as well as special cars and tracks.
